poem:
Title: "In the Fever of a Drenched Ballot"

They posture, penlit, Labour's knights,
A promise etched in neon lights,
Zero sums in performance plight,
Chaos scribed in Tory's write. 

A sopping Sunak speaks of storm,
In rainclad truths, election's form,
Stirring fears in climate's norm,
Amidst the downpour, dissent is born.

From social strife to sea's unrest,
The ballot cast in nature's jest,
For Earth-weary hearts, one final test.
